reviewTitle: Bought two. Neither one worked well
reviewDescription: The first one creaked every time I pushed any button. The buttons didn’t react. They did noting when I pushed. So I chalked it up to a bad remote and bought another. It worked okay for a couple of weeks. Then nothing but frustration. I can push a button 6, 8 times and nothing happens. This thing is a piece of junk. All I want is a remote that works and all I got was a rock in the shape of a remote.

The reviews that this remote got are honestly quite unbelievable, the terrible quality immediately presented itself as soon as I pulled it out of the packaging.  Not only did it feel really cheap but when I put batteries in it they would slide around not always making contact with the metal prongs, and yes I put the correct batteries in before you ask. This problem would make the remote next to unusable because 90% of the time the batteries wouldn't make contact to carry out the input when pressing buttons.  Overall terrible product, just stick to the name brand Samsung remote and not this 3rd party universal garbage.

reviewTitle: Buy literally any other comparable remote
reviewDescription: We had to purchase a replacement remote for our Samsung tv and figured it didn’t matter where the replacement was purchased from. This remote barely works, the sensor is trash, so you have to try over and over to get it to work. The buttons stick and you have to press really hard, multiple times. It truly shouldn’t be this hard to hit pause/play on a tv in 2024.

reviewTitle: Great at first but stops working
reviewDescription: I purchased two remotes within the time span of a year. At first the remote works great does its job but after a few months or weeks it stops working entirely. I had to mess with the batteries from time to time with the first one and would fall apart completely if it hit the floor. The second, none of the buttons were responding after a three weeks of buying the remote it was tricky to turn off the tv or change the channel. The remote is affordable but I would not recommend!

reviewTitle: Cheap junk. Poorly aligned battery connections, that don't quite fit AAA batteries.
reviewDescription: Horrible junk.Get it out of the package, try to put the AAA batteries in the remote. They won't stay in. They don't even make a solid contact with the connectors.Had to strech out the connectors and then tape the batteries into the remote to get it to work.Absolute TRASH.

I bought a remote a week ago, but unfortunately, it didn't work. I thought maybe it was just that one remote, so I tried another one, but that didn't work either. They both only worked for a few hours and then stopped completely. I wouldn't recommend wasting your time or money on this product from China. It's just not worth it.

The cover was almost impossible to open, almost returned it, when i finally got it open the batteries dont fit. Like literally the battery space is bigger than the batteries. Unfortunately my 30 days to return have passed and am stuck with a remote I never used.

reviewTitle: Main circle button in operations from the box
reviewDescription: Not a quality product.  I was looking for an inexpensive replacement for my Samsung Frame TV, but the quality on this is low. Direct from the box the main circular button is in operational unless pressed with tremendous force.  Just product, avoid it.

This was not the product I ordered, and it did not work. The volume control button on my original Samsung remote quit working, so the only reason I ordered this one was for the volume control. Pushing the volume button only muted/unmuted the TV. I returned it.

Purchased in October’23. They barely work at this point.(Yes, new batteries were installed and didn’t help.) The buttons are mushy and sluggish, and it’s nearly impossible sometimes to maneuver unless you hit the buttons precisely (which changes all the time). Cheap junk.

reviewTitle: Works out the box. Good remote.
reviewDescription: I purchased this remote due to we lost the original one and we can’t find it. This does the same thing as the original with some minor inconsistencies. The plastic feels like hard plastic, not soft like the original. Ours came with the CH smudged like it was a return and sent to us but for all these minor issues. We can’t complain for a $9 remote.

Our senior dog had a senior moment and destroyed our original remote, this worked as soon as we put the batteries in. Only complaint is the buttons are much firmer and make a clicking noise every time.
This remote is super easy to use! All you have to do is insert the batteries in the remote and point to the television! Great item!!

reviewTitle: Sometimes you'll need to press the button a few times
reviewDescription: I'm on my 9th remote,  dogs love the crunch. Reminds me of these books at poochville.store
This universal remote is great. Batteries are popped in and it’s ready to go. Would recommend this remote is need a new one
Remote arrived with a scratch on the dial pad, but otherwise, it works great, and connected automatically.
works, buttons are a little hard to press

reviewTitle: It does what it is supposed to do.
reviewDescription: We have purchased it twice.  It works well but over time loses its accuracy.  The first lasted 8 months until we had to purchase the second one recently.

reviewTitle: That is can work on any television
reviewDescription: Great remote highly recommended

Good replacement for my original remote that had the solar recharge panel in the back. Accidentally spilled hot chocolate all over the controller one night and immediately putting it in rice for days did zilch.Downloading an app like Smart Things irked me as to why they need so much access to my personal info. 👎Search results offered a bunch of uncertain knockoffs asking an insane $80-$130 for an identical remote that’s made in China. But that working wasn’t even a sure thing? Nope, didn’t appeal to my sensibility.Then comes this baby. Legit reviews convinced me enough to try it. Tada! It was like magic, it worked straight out of the box right after inserting new batts and without pairing. All the buttons like Netflix and Prime Video work nice. Escape road to TV heaven reopened. 🥳The controller is a bit thicker due to needing batteries. I’m fine with it not being solar/usb rechargeable.(Someone mentioned being unable to open the back to insert batteries— it’s a one piece unibody design so the entire backside has to come off. Maybe they were looking for a small little panel to remove?) 🤷‍♀️Happy.—UPDATE—Docking a star because the circular directional pad started feeling super sticky within a week. Must push down rather hard to get things moving. Sometimes the reaction is delayed a bit so I end up scrolling too far. :( Also the tactile feeling of pressing up, down, left or right isn’t there anymore. Not sure what happened to make it feel this way suddenly, like I spilled hot choco on it again. Anyway, all other buttons are fine.Btw, this is a must-point-directly-toward-TV remote, unlike the original… in case this is important for your decision-making.
Multiple issues.

I returned the first remote because it did not work. No red lights, no activity. I used two sets of new batteries and it didn’t turn on nor responded when I pressed the return and play/pause buttons together. No blinking red light showed when I tried it to pair it to my TV. Then I returned that one and just got the replacement, same thing. Wouldn’t work.My TV is listed as one that works with this remote and I just need to put the batteries in and it would work, but it didn’t.I won’t order a third one!!!

I bought 2 remotes and one works and on the other the buttons don't work properly.  You have to press several times for them to make contact. The up volume button also doesn't work. So I'm keeping the one that works and returning the defective one.
You get what you pay for. Cheap crap. Don’t buy it.
They won’t work. I bought 2 to be safe but put batteries in and can’t pair because no power.
The buttons on this thing is literally the worst
Remote stopped working after two days of purchasing the item. Not worth it wish I could return it in order to get a refund but I lost the packaging.

Avoid this product. The right direction function started breaking after a few weeks. If you enjoy pressing a button 8 times to have it work one time then this remote is for you. Please make better products.

really horrible device. complete waste of money. the unit arrived on time as usual but literally broke into pieces just trying to slide the battery cover plate off to install the batteries. straight into the garbage...Dont waste your time or money on this..... suggest tracking down an OEM remote if youre going to spend the money...youre not getting any sort of deal on this...
Doesn't work at all. Don't waste your time ordering and returning a defective product
Batteries do not fit tightly.  They actually rattle.  As a result, they don't make reliable contact.  The control doesn't pair with the TV.  Very poor quality.  Not recommended.

I had the tape the AAA batteries down because they were loose in the compartment. Ordering a better one but have to keep this one to at least turn my TV on.Volume doesn’t work and neither do theButtons for Prime and Netflix.Will return after receiving a better remote.
Buttons that don’t work = play / pause, return, 123, mute.  So if you’re happy with a controller that doesn’t control much - this one’s for you.  Else, don’t bother.

reviewTitle: Stopped working in less than a year
reviewDescription: Worked great when we first got it. Now, about 11 months later, the buttons are terrible and sometimes don't work at all.
Half the button is not working after a month of using it.

reviewTitle: Don't buy. Can't even open the battery case cover
reviewDescription: Ridiculous! Impossible to open the battery case cover. The catch doesn't work.
Bought this twice. First time was great, after 6 months bought again and quality was terrible, do not work properly
The middle button does not work properly and needs to be pressed multiple times or held down to work
This remote sucks. Does not work & Lasted for a month. Buy it if you want to waste your money.  I can’t return, what a scam!

reviewTitle: Remote works half the time, and only when youre up close
reviewDescription: This remote is entirely frustrating. It works, but only if youre really close to the tv. I literally have to get up and walk to the tv to change the channel. Just a bad and cheap product.

reviewTitle: Doesn't work properly. Never buy again.
reviewDescription: Not all the buttons work on this product, some work intermittently.spend 3 more bucks and get the genuine Samsung made remote.

Looks exactly like the original remote that came with the TV, and that’s where the similarities end.The first thing you’ll notice is the toggles on the volume and are stiff and awkward to push up or down, and feels extremely cheap in your hand. Hard to imagine that could be an issue, but it absolutely is. I don’t know how it has good reviews. Maybe i got a lemon. Anyway, the remote has completely stopped working after like 2 months. Avoid this thing
Received this remote and after a week the buttons stopped working properly. Have to press super hard for it to work sometimes.
Not good remote botton is very hard not working properly waste of money

My wife lost the original and in a bind, I went to a big box store and bought an el-cheapo $20 universal (not this one) and it works kind of. Purchased this one here from Amazon since it is for the model of TV I have (). No programming is needed but it performs terribly. You constantly have to mash the buttons repeatedly to get it to do anything at all. Throwing it away and going back to the $20 el cheapo from the big box, at least it works all the time.

Initially I was very pleased with the remote, as it worked every bit as well as the original.  After about two months, I absolutely HATED the thing.  I have to push a button on average about four times before the remote “recognizes” that a button has been activated.  It’s so incredibly annoying, and I’m back on Amazon today to find a similar remote by a different company.  (I did try changing out the batteries, but to no effect.)  I recommend you steer clear of this one!
Pretty horrible. The numbers stick and essential it does not work!
It’s totally garbage. Do not buy this remote. cheap Chinese stuff.
Remote worked only for 4 months, it is not working
Received faulty remote. Brand new batteries inserted and still doesnt work

reviewTitle: do not buy these style of remotes, go old school for longevity
reviewDescription: Edit - do not buy the sleeker/minimal style of Samsung remotes whether OEM or replicas.Whether USB-C rechargable or AA/AAA batteries - they are all built to be disposable.I thought this was a Samsung flaw per what came in the box, but I know now after buying many varieties of this kind of remote over the years that they are just a cheaply made design.Between their bluetooth connection issues or the fact the main circle which will quickly degrade and eventuallly stop responding despite fresh batteries, I've had it.I have never had such a consistently awful remote control performance for a TV in my entire life.Do yourself a favor and stick to the older-looking, original Samsung remotes with the video game buttons on the bottom.They dont look as cool but they dont require bluetooth and the arrow keys last how you would expect TV remotes to last.I replaced all newer-style remotes with the older model and have had zero issues.

I've fon we thru several of these in the past month all thanks due to my pup. I've received some good,, some iffy and a dud. So it's a gamble! This last one worked terribly and then stopped working. They want you to pay to return it or you can take it to Satples for free if you still have the original packaging. So roll the dice if you order this,  you might get one of the good ones.

It feels really cheap. I had to put something between the cover and the batteries because they we not making contact. The batteries last about 6 months which is very short for a remote control.You have to point the remote straight to the TV. Most of the times you have to press multiple times on the bottoms.The only positive point is that it’s pre-configured, so as soon as you put the batteries on it starts working.

This remote is not worth it! The select button area and button sucks. Moving left to right or up and down requires you to position the remote in all kinds of ways to get a signal to the tv. I would return, if I didn’t have it this long. 😑
Does it work with my Samsung Frame? Yes. Do you have to click whatever button you want to use 2, 3, 7 times? Also yes. Worst remote I have ever had.
Horrible

I bought this two months ago and after six weeks the buttons are hard to use and doesn't work unless you hit in many times.  Complete piece of junk and can't return it.  STAY AWAY!!!  I never write negative reviews but this was necessary.
Device came completely apart when the poorly designed battery cover was removed.  The pieces refused to go back together.
The left-right rocker broke within a week, and the power button no longer works after two months. Do not buy.

reviewTitle: If you ABSOLUTELY need a remote...
reviewDescription: This is NOT a Samsung remote. It works, but barely. I'm having to press the buttons ridiculously hard to get a response. I should've known with the low price. Save yourself the trouble and get a genuine Samsung remote or a Logitech universal. When I do, I'll be burning this POS with extreme prejudice.
As soon as pulled the remote out the bag it didn't work. Buttons were too sticky to move !👎👎
Inoperable and seller does not accept returns.
Second time i bought it, and having same problem, its not working again, not even 3 month

Poor quality remote. The battery compartment is too loose to hold the batteries securely. You can shake the remote and see the batteries rattle inside. Not to forget when batteries lose contact with the metal parts, the remote will not work until you reposition the remote.I don't even want to bother returning such a poor quality remote. Don't buy!!

reviewTitle: Stopped working in couple of months
reviewDescription: Horrible quality . Regret buying it stopped working in 2 monthsAvoid this at all cost

reviewTitle: This remote broke the voulme wont work
reviewDescription: Had it one day and it broke the voulme don't work please refund this product
Crap. In order to installbatteries, had to pry the back off with a number of different instruments. This is what it opened to! 😡 Going to a local store to buy a real remote tomorrow!

Update: buttons have failed and this is now junk.  I went to the Sony website and ordered a true OEM remote $$$ which I should have done in the first place.  Learned my lesson with these knockoffs.After accidently dumping my Sony OEM remote in a glass of bubly, I needed a replacement quick.  Ordered this one.It does work right out of the box.  All the buttons are there.But, it needs two AA batteries, unlike the original which had solar/USB powered rechargeable internal battery.And after a few months of usage the up/down audio buttons are failing.  So will likely be shopping for a replacement sooner than I'd hoped.
Channel button is broken.

reviewTitle: Stopped working in less than 3 months
reviewDescription: Saw the price and had to grab it. Took me about a month to remember to get batteries and now 3 months after I bought the control, it doesn't work anymore. Of course, the return window is closed. Super bummed I'm going to have to invest in another one.
Every time I turn off my TV, the remote has to be reprogrammed.
The buttons are not sustainable.After a few weeks, they stop working properly
Volume and channel buttons don't work. Don't purchase this item. I had to return it and purchase the 13.99 remote.
This replacement remote is worse than the remote it replaced.

This remote control is hard to use. It’s horrible. When I go to use it, I have to literally point it right at the TV  when trying to turn it on, it takes several times, pushing the power button for it to finally turn on or off I have to hold it down very hard in order to even do so. It literally is a painful product too late for a refund.

This remote “worked” for about a week. Quotes being used because even during that week the remote still only worked about half the time, requiring buttons to be pushed 5-10 times sometimes to make anything happen on the TV. 0/10. Would not recommend.

reviewTitle: It’s better than not having a remote
reviewDescription: It paired with the tv out of the box so that was nice but this thing is kind of garbage. The buttons only work about 25% of the time so you have to repeatedly push them to do anything. This is paired with a delayed response time so often you push the button several times and nothing is happening but then it all happens at once. This is especially annoying because it frequently leads to opening the wrong app. The volume and channel buttons are a notch above worthless. You have to fight with it to get it to change the volume and when it finally does budge it frequently gets stuck turning the tv volume all the down or (my favorite) all the way up. This is wonderful during the babies nap time. This remote is better than not having a remote at all but just barely.
Remote did nor work at all.  It didn't even light up when batteries were placed.
No instructions. Cannot open battery compartment.
They don’t even work

reviewTitle: Was not compatible with my Fire stick
reviewDescription: Upset it did not work the tv channels only volume.

reviewTitle: Horrible Product - Did Not Work for Me
reviewDescription: The replacement remote that I bought for my Samsung TV does not work. I tried to use it but it had several issues and I had to return it.

reviewTitle: Half of the buttons don't work
reviewDescription: The remote works, but barely. Half the buttons don't work and I cant change the HDMI with these buttons which is what i would use it for. Turns on and controls volume, and you can use the D-pad.
This is so bad. It was not working.
Battery terminals did not make contact with the batteries. The well for the batteries are far too large and the batteries rattle around, audibly, within the unit.
Batteries didn't sit inside the remote.  No instructions for pairing, not to mention it didn't work.
It worked for 3 months.  Buttons stopped working.  No Prime controls. Look elsewhere, this is a joke

reviewTitle: Prepare to click your life away
reviewDescription: By far the worst remote I ever bought I'm so upset that my original broke.No matter how close to the TV you are you need to click rapidly and hold for buttons to work.The volume control feel stuck and tightIt just a hassle to constantly have to click and hold and click and hope that what you're trying to do works.Forget using it to search for anything.Bad all aroundThe only similarity is the look of the remoteDO NOT BUY

El motivo de comprar el control remoto fue para substituir el original de la Smart tv, porque el boton de cambio de canales dejo de funcionar, quede sorprendido de lo barato que me costo este control nuevo y lo estaba esperando con muchas ganas, le puse baterias nuevas y de inmediato se comunico con la tv, sin embargo el boton de cambio de canales en el control nuevo tampoco funciono, me comunique al centro de atencion de los fabricantes de la television ellos me indicaron que podia hacer para tratar de hacerlo funcionar pero fue inutil, las indicaciones no sirvieron para nada, adicionalmente el producto es chino y no es la primera vez que me pasa esto, completamente desagradable compra.

reviewTitle: The directional pad partially stopped working.
reviewDescription: When pressing down on the remote that I had for roughly two days, the “clicking” function is not longer working. It makes it difficult to press down directionally, and I have to press it multiple times. The remote wasn’t damaged in any way, it just stopped functioning properly. Might just be a one time dud, but it still is kinda lame all things considered.

It worked just fine

reviewTitle: It works on a 2020 Samsung QLED
reviewDescription: We bought this remotes for our Samsung QLED that we bought earlier this year. The remote connected right away and we were able to use instantly. The only thing is that it will disconnect from the TV every once in a while so you have to reset again but it only takes a few seconds. Overall it’s a great replacement for the price.

I didn't like that the shape is different than the original because the photo makes it seem identical. One other difference is that it needs to be pointed directly at the TV, unlike the original, for some reason. But otherwise, yeah, it does the job and is fine.
It's a good little remote. I wish I was able to speak into it to find shows....
Works with my Q60. Compared the the OEM remote the quality feels cheaper.
It works good
Works
It would be perfect if it had a source button. Besides that it works better than the original remote.

reviewTitle: Next best thing to Samsung remote that comes with TVs
reviewDescription: I would have given this 5 stars except for I didn't care for the odd sloped angle shape of it because it slips out of my hand easily.  Otherwise it's a perfect replica of the remote i love that came with my newer Samsung TV.  But for the price I 100% recommend it!  And there's no setup, just put in the batteries and it works instantly

reviewTitle: it works but the remote has to show infront of TV.
reviewDescription: it works when I face the remote towards tv. real remote would work without facings towards tv.

reviewTitle: It works but is not exactly like OEM remote
reviewDescription: See my photos, on the left is this remote, on the right is Samsung OEM.  The biggest problem I have with this remote is the Netflix button is often mistaken for the back button.  Not a big deal but if you are used to the Samsung button placement you may find yourself starting up Netflix by accident.There is no voice control button, not a dealbreaker for me as I never used it anyway.Other than that the button click is louder but everything does work if your looking for a cheap replacement.
The power button doesn't always work on the first push but other than that, it's a great replacement.

reviewTitle: Not exactly replacement, doesn't work exactly like original
reviewDescription: Not an exact replacement to Samsung Remote you get when you buy a Samsung TV in the US. Also the signal strength is weak, has to be pointed directly at the TV with nothing at all in its path. This was not the case with the original remote. All in all it does its job 85% of the time. Not bad for the price.

reviewTitle: Worked right away for our Samsung TV.
reviewDescription: Works fine for Samsung TV. Changes channels and volume but the 3 buttons on the bottom for NETFLIX PRIME AND ROKU do absolutely nothing. But the home button takes me to the screen to pick.  No directions to make those buttons work either.
Took it out of the box and it worked great. Dog chewed the factory remote and needed a new one. I am sure I will have to buy this again and would do so in a heartbeat.

I bought this to replace the original pen remote that got broken. We have an Apple TV attached to the RV and the original remote will control both the RV and the Apple TV. This remote will only control the tv.  If you don’t use accessories it is a great remote but if you want to control other devices like the original then you need to order an own controller
After our dog chewed up the remote, we needed a replacement. This I've arrived several days early (which is exactly what we needed)!

reviewTitle: Buttons are oddly firm, however it works.
reviewDescription: Sometimes the power button will seemingly "double tap" so my TV turns on & off again. Other buttons will also require a good amount of force and do a bit more than what was intended.

reviewTitle: Works great and simple to connect!
reviewDescription: My wife hated the remote that came with our tv! It was one of those universal remotes that can be programmed to control several devices which we don't have. I was looking for a remote that was simple to use and this one has been great! right out of the box, placed two AA batteries in it and it connect seamlessly!  The only thing I don't like is the volume button uses a lever action for up and down and press for mute. it just feels a little awkward, but ease of use has outweighed that one small detail.

reviewTitle: Worked right away once batteries are installed
reviewDescription: Getting the top to slide off to install the batteries is extremely tough.  I need to get a very thin knife and went around the remote on the creases to get it open. Once I got through that, the remote worked great!

reviewTitle: Works straight outta the box! No set up.
reviewDescription: Take about easy! I removed it from the box, added batteries, pointed it at my T.V. And BAM! It works without ANY setup. I’m not sure how that’s possible. It’s a lot more simple than my last remote, which I appreciate. One pointer, I’ve seen someone in the reviews say their volume and channel buttons don’t work. When I tried it at first, I thought the same until I referred to the instructions listed on this page. You’ll need to push the button up and down, not straight down.I have no complaints!

I am so happy. I no longer need to get my lazy butt up to use the volume or turn off the tv. I was shocked when it came with no directions. But that is because it is not needed. I came right into my room and turned on the tv. That’s it. I live in an apartment with shared WiFi. It’s is like magic that it automatically worked for my tv. So happy. It works for the tv functions and my fire stick with no set up.

Just got my product today, took a chance after the review that I saw.  My remote got broken by my toddler and I need one that would like me to turn on Neflix.  So far so good, easy to use, battery fits well and the back is easy to remove, although a bit tight.  The product was made in China, it says so on the shipping label.  Wouldn't complain, let's see if it breaks within the month, then I need to return it, if it doesn't, I'm keeping it, cause it is 9.99 only.

reviewTitle: The remote arrived fast and in good condition.
reviewDescription: Hopefully it lasts longer than the last Samsung remote. The one I got with my TV started dying pretty quick when certain buttons stopped working, but I'm hoping this one is better. The volume button is a little stiff, but overall it seems like a good remote so far.

I know this sounds ridiculous and yes I’ve been through my couch 4 times now looking for it but I’m tired of looking and I ordered this remote. Plugged in a couple of AA batteries and it worked immediately on my 2023 Samsung S90C OLED television. Highly recommend for $10.

reviewTitle: Saved me $$$ on with my Samsung TV

reviewTitle: I haven’t had a remote in years…
reviewDescription: I haven’t had a remote in years but finally decided that it was time to buy one. This remote is great, immediately connects to your tv after you put batters in it. But, it is hard to get the back off so that you can put the batteries in. Plus the Netflix, prime and Roku buttons do not work and it takes a while for certain buttons to work. Or maybe it does but there isn't a mic button.Maybe there is a way to map a button to be a mic but I don't know how to do that.Otherwise, it worked seamlessly. reviewDescription: It looks very well made and looks just like a factory remote. I’m sure it probably works for a lot of Samsung smart tv’s just not mine. But with Amazon’s easy return policy, try it and see if it works for your needs.

reviewTitle: Works ok but the original is better
reviewDescription: Great deal but the quality is not as good as tge original. I have to press the buttons twice at times and point it directly at the TV to get where I want.

reviewTitle: It does what it’s intended for
reviewDescription: So the remote is ok. It works as intended. You do have to push the button 2-3 times to get it to respond though. I have changed out my batteries and it didn’t fix the problem. Like I said though it works and more than that what is it really supposed to do.

reviewTitle: Everything but Volume Control through to the Optical Outline Works
reviewDescription: My Samsung solar/internal battery is flaking.  This replacement takes real AA batteries.  Two things: (1) the button pressing is much more cumbersome and does not move with ease.  I can live with that. (2) ALL buttons seem to work accept for the volume up and down with the optical line out to the Sonos.  Basically, if I use the volume control for the internal tv speaker it works fine!  Weirdly, as the TV passes through the signal to turn up and down the volume to the Sonos sound bar it takes like 100 pushes to the 1 push on the native remote.  What gives with that?  For $10 as an emergency back up to turn it on/off (and then use with internal speakers), I'll probably just keep it but need to find a real replacement

It paired with my tv when the batteries were out in. It could turn on/off, adjust the volume and click through apps. The buttons are stiff even after a month. I still have it but it is way to much of a hassle to send it back to amazon, get a refund, and so on, thus I just threw the darn thing out.  I am definitely much more skiddish when it comes to buying electronic products from Amazon.  I do NOT think there is any kind of quality control. I would also imagine that some robot grabs it from a shelf and then takes it somewhere for packaging and distribution.  Amazon is really going down hill fast.  Amazon used to send you paperwork for returning a product hassle free and you could use the box and packaging it came with to send your product back to Amazon with little or no hassle.  However, Amazon is making it more and more of a hassle to return a product.  In other words, they better get it right the first time or your screwed....If the buttons worked properly and it would have been much easier to return the product I probably would have done that.  Heck, your lucky to get a package inventory/receipt in the box any more.  Come on Amazon, you should not take your customers for granted.  You, like many other companies can go under, especially when your customer service has gone down hill so fast and so far.  Good customer service is the BACKBONE of every company!!!!

I could care less if it has useless app buttons, such as Netflix & Prime,  since I can always access apps from within the TV. All that volume button controls is mute and unmute, w/o a volume control. reviewTitle: once you get the cover off and put batteries it is great
reviewDescription: To get the batteries in1. Remove the front lenses (use a knife and pry it off)2. Use a thin knife around the enter end pry open ( it will stick about the middle section  (be aware the volume & volume buttons may pop out (replace same (may go in backwards easy to check)3. Pry the battery carrier out - the unit may open with either the battery carrier stuck or opens the right way4. Install battery (not right way as shown in the diagram - note they are a little loose)5. Check the fit of the rubber buttons and all the hard buttons in place6. snap closed ( if the volume and ch buttons are backwards ( one of mine was open again and turn around)7. Replace the lense8. It works

reviewTitle: Works for infrared but not bluetooth
reviewDescription: The description says it has "function 100% the same as the original", but that is not true. The original remote uses bluetooth and infrared to communicate with the TV, so you don't need line-of-sight with the TV's infrared receiver. This remote only uses infrared, so you need line-of-sight and you have to carefully aim it at the TV. Also the original remote supports voice control and this one doesn't.

reviewTitle: Works just like the original - INSTANTLY!
reviewDescription: Given the nature of many “generic”  low quality replacements for remote controls, I wasn’t expecting too much from ordering this replacement remote for our Samsung “Big” LCD TV.  The right arrow in the round arrow selector keypad on our old original Samsung remote had failed working, so the search for a new remote was ON! We settled on this one as it looked outwardly 94% identical except for the shortcut buttons to Netflix and Amazon at the bottom row of the keypad.The remote feels solid and the button action is good.Short version: Plug in a pair of AA batteries and you are back up and running instantaneously! No programming needed,  except maybe for the shortcut buttons to Netflix or Amazon that I would never use anyways!

I actually am considering buying a couple more just to have one at every table in the living room. No more searching for the remote.  I 100% recommend buying this replacement remote.

But this was cheaper than remotes listed for my specific TV. Everyone complains about the click of the buttons are louder but maybe that also has to do with its brand new. Worked perfect for my Samsung Smart TV that I bought in 2019. The remote did not require any programming. Just put in the batteries and it’s ready to go.

Very bad experience, clearly we can say its poorly made. Especially after using it, i am really disappointed with quality. The buttons are very hard to press.

After a few months, the remote still worked - but you had to press the button's very hard to get a response on the TV.The netflix button also didn't work as advertised.Just ordered a generic replacement.

reviewTitle: One button missing and two buttons that do nothing
reviewDescription: I received this remote yesterday. Upon inspection this remote doesn't have a button for a microphone and it has a Rakuten button that doesn't do anything as Rakuten is no more. The button on top to the right doesn't do anything either. The Netflix and Prime buttons do workI wouldn't have purchased this remote had I realized that there is no voice command button and that two they buttons do nothing. At least replacement remotes are inexpensive so I'll most likely purchase a different one.I'm really surprised by so many 4 and 5 star reviews
This remote does not work well. We have to click it several times and hold it down for it to actually move to the next page. We have only had it a year and are going to replace it. Not worth it.

What are the two things you do most often with your remote control? Turn on/off, volume up/down right? This remote will make you LONG FOR THE RELEASE THAT DEATH WILL BRING before you are able to do these things. Sure, on/off is easy. But that bar that has a plus at one end and a carrot at the other? Press the plus sign and it MUTES the tv. Press it again and JUST FOR A NANOSECOND the volume control comes onscreen before vanishing. You will never see it again. Press it again and sometimes a bar with 1 through 9 appears on your screen but the numbers are meaningless, they are not related to volume, or for that matter, to anything at all. You will search on the Samsung website for a remote control guide and when you find it, you will read a childish description of how to press a button up or down to make your volume increase or decrease. BUT IT WILL NOT SHOW YOU THE BUTTON IT IS DESCRIBING. You will hunt through user groups for hours before finally learning that the video control button also controls volume IF YOU PRESS IT NORTH OR SOUTH. That's correct. A tiny button that was made to pressed by a Korean child's fingers has to be pressed at the top or the bottom to control volume.I HATE THIS REMOTE SO MUCH IT COURSES THROUGH. MY BLOOD LIKE POISON

reviewTitle: Many of the buttons do not work+no microphone button!
reviewDescription: The buttons for Netflix, Amazon, etc and the multi-colored dots that control A/B/C/D for other tv functions for the smart tv do NOT work. And there is NO microphone button.If I had to do it again, I would shell out a few extra dollars for the real brand that is compatible with my smart tv and ALL the buttons work. It’s just ok for channels and volume -  that.is.it. Hence the two star rating. It’s pretty much junk compared with the real remote.

reviewTitle: Buttons are very hard to push
reviewDescription: The remote works as advertised, but it is very difficult to push buttons consistently. Sometimes they simply stick and you have to jiggle the whole remote to get the buttons to work. I do not recommend this unit.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: It’s a cheap replacement tv remote, that works like a cheap replacement tv remote. The tv doesn’t register Im pushing a button 90% of the time, takes forever to do anything simple because you’re clicking the same button over and over again.Pulled the batteries out multiple times, paired and repaired it. I don’t know maybe I just got a dud

Bought as a secondary living room remote so I have one when my husband falls asleep.Ok, it works. However, this thing has been bugging me for quite a while. Doesn’t always register the button you have pressed. I press 2-3 times & wave it around A LOT. Had it at least a year & I decided life is too short. Amazon has a genuine remote for my TV so I just ordered it. Isn’t much more than this was. Wish I would have found the genuine one back then.
Does not work well. You have to click several times and point directly. The buttons are stiff. Me no likey.

reviewTitle: Buttons are VERY HARD to click
reviewDescription: Overall, the remote functions well, but the buttons require substantial force to operate. Navigating channels or adjusting the volume can be quite frustrating due to the stiffness of the buttons. Though the remote is functional, potential buyers should bear in mind that it necessitates a significant amount of pressure for use.
Remote works well with the Samsung tv. Only issue is the buttons are very stiff and do not click. The volume button is very hard to maneuver as well.
The remote buttons are very hard and it takes long time for the actions to take place.  I wish Samsung sells their remotes on their site.

Remote came paired and ready to go with my Samsung. There is no microphone button, but I  didn't expect one. The main issue is that the buttons are so stiff they are actually difficult to push. My kids can't push hard enough, the elderly may have an issue as well.

UPDATE year later: unfortunately the volume button is weak plastic and sticking at times.  All the buttons are unreliable often pressing a number of times until the channels change or app selections onscreen move.  The aftermarket quality shows its true colors a year later.  I originally had the positive post below.We have a 55” Samsung 4K UHD Flatscreen TV that still works fine since 2016.  The original Samsung remote’s buttons started to act up and either was delayed in raising the volume or turning on/off.  This was after a couple of new batteries switched out.  So we figured it wasn't the batteries.Anyway long story short, right off the package - this new remote worked as advertised!  Its not a generic model but it responds just as a new Samsung remote.  I also like that you can feel some buttons more since there are rubber surface buttons, unlike the original.  My only CON would be that the up buttons for volume and channel are stiff compared to original.  For example, I have to dig in with my fingers a bit to activate volume up or channel up.  Overall, it does what it supposed to do.

I like that it works right out of the box, initially a pretty easy set up/pairing with the tv. Eventually, every time I power the tv on, something pops up on the screen saying I have to pair the remote by pressing pause/play & back arrow buttons. Every. Single. Time.Minor issue is the “quick” button at the bottom, rakeu tv, does not work (my original remote had Hulu). If I accidentally press it, tv says that it’s not an app available in my country so not for USA customers.My other majorly frustrating issue is that I have to push some buttons so hard just to get it to function. I did have a similar pairing issue with another non-Samsung remote but not as frequent. Trying another brand remote because I just can’t stand putting up with these frustrations any more!
